sections.heading: 1. ENTITLEMENT (NEW FROM APRIL 2025)
sections.text:
1.1 Employees are entitled to up to 12 weeks' neonatal care leave (day-1 right, no qualifying period) if their baby:
- Is admitted to hospital within 28 days of birth, and
- Requires neonatal care for 7 consecutive days or more

1.2 Both parents can take neonatal leave (each entitled to 12 weeks).

1.3 Leave must be taken in the first 68 weeks after birth.

sections.heading: 2. NEONATAL CARE PAY
sections.text:
2.1 Statutory Neonatal Care Pay (SNCP) is payable at £184.03/week [2025 rate] for up to 12 weeks.

2.2 Eligibility: 26 weeks' continuous employment and earnings above LEL (£123/week).

2.3 SNCP can be taken alongside other statutory payments (e.g., maternity, paternity).

2.4 [OPTIONAL: Enhanced neonatal care pay - [DETAILS]]

sections.heading: 3. NOTIFICATION
sections.text:
3.1 Notify your manager as soon as reasonably practicable that you wish to take neonatal leave, providing:
- Expected start date
- Expected duration

3.2 Medical evidence may be required (e.g., hospital admission letter).

sections.heading: 4. RIGHTS
sections.text:
4.1 Your contract continues during leave (except pay).

4.2 Holiday continues to accrue.

4.3 You are entitled to return to the same job.

4.4 Protection from detriment or dismissal for taking neonatal leave.
